persona.label: Customer Support Lead (Legacy)
background: Tasked with 'knowledge extraction' for a new AI chatbot
Laid off 3 months post-launch due to 'efficiency gains'
constraints: Employer prioritized volume over resolution quality
Outsourcing of tier 2 issues followed the AI rollout
Skills felt commoditized by knowledge mapping
persona.goal: Identify how to move into high-complex support (Customer Success/Ops) where human judgment is the product.

question.summary: We spent 6 months training 'SupportAI' only for the company to lay off 40% of the team. I'm now looking for roles that aren't first-line screen-only.

shouldInclude: Distinction between high-volume triage (replaceable) and strategic success (resilient)
Focus on roles like Customer Success Manager or Implementation Specialist
Mitigation: Positioning as the 'human layer' for complex escalations
